summary: Spider-Man & Firefly (Peter Parker x Reader) - Chapter Five
title: Spider-Man & Firefly (Peter Parker x Reader) - Chapter Five
body:
Previous Chapter
Series Masterlist

A/N: I know, I know. ‘Girl, it’s been a whole ass month since you’ve updated this series’ I knoooooow. Sorry…about that.

Words: 1.7k

Warnings: Implied sexual assault, Violence, Mild swearing.

The next evening, you had arrived at your meeting spot earlier than you had originally planned and you could thank Academic Decathlon for that. Mr Harrington was off with the flu, so your weekly, after-school meeting had been cancelled, which gave you the chance to get some homework done before meeting with your new friend - But who are you kidding?

Your homework remained neatly tidied away in your schoolbag as you sat overlooking the city, Wednesday’s sunset reaching its final stages as a faint orange hue created a perfect outline of Manhattan.

You had expected to be alone since it was hours until you were due to meet up with your partner. But, alas, there was Spider-Man, arriving only a few minutes after you.

“Firefly, huh?” Your hooded companion mulled over your name choice as he paced back and forward behind you.

“Yeah. I like it.” You responded.

“But you don’t produce fire.”

“Well, neither do fireflies.” You said, matter-of-factly.

“Fair point.” He nodded. “So, uh, what now? Where do we go from here?”

Before you could respond, you felt a chill course through your body as you shuddered. Your partner grabbed your arm.

“Did you feel that too?” He cautiously asked. You nodded before a ruckus on the streets below caught both of your attention. The click of high heels.

“Down there.” The boy whispered, his finger outstretched toward the source of the noise.

A young woman in a thick duffle coat was running down the alleyway below you, the sound of her heels becoming irregular as she realised that she was not only being followed, but that she had reached a dead end. A group of rather large men slowly approached her, lead by a bald man in a muscle tee, with a moustache that could rival Hulk Hogan. A blonde man stuck to his side, clutching onto and rummaging through the contents of the woman’s handbag. But…

If they already had her purse, then why were they still pursuing her?

Oh no.

“We need to help her. Now.” You rushed, scrambling to your feet as you stealthily began to descend the fire escape.

“Woah, woah!” Spider-Man grabbed you before you could move any further. “We need a plan of attack, we can’t just jump in there without a game plan.”

“Well, any ideas? We don’t have much time to devise something.” You said, trying to hurry the boy.

“Alright, um…!” He said as he fumbled over ideas in his head, “Okay.”

You listened intently as the boy revealed his plan.

“Have you ever seen that really old movie, The Phantom Menace?”

“Come on now, no more running, doll.,” One of the men taunted, “Nowhere for you to go!” He added, earning a low chuckle from the group. The gang leader pulled out a knife as he stalked up to the woman.

“Don’t worry, we’re gonna have some fun, just as long as you keep that pretty mouth of yours shut.” The bald man sneered, causing the woman to hyperventilate, suppressing a scream in fear of what they would do if she made a sound.

“Don’t think that’s going to happen, fellas,” Spider-Man said with an impressive amount of confidence as you stood on the edge of the fire escape directly above the action. You both jumped down, completely synchronised, landing in front of the men. “Now, how about you leave that girl alone?” He continued, which caused the group to snigger at the two of you.

“I don’t think you heard him.” You warned, your partner’s bravery seeming to ignite the courage within you. You opened your hand, watching the veins under your skin change to a warm yellow, as the light danced down the inside of your arm before surfacing at the tips of your fingers. “He said, leave the girl alone.”

“And what are you gonna do to stop us?” The leader laughed, brandishing his buck knife in your direction.

“He had to ask, didn’t he?” Spider-Man laughed as he whispered into your ear, “Okay, we got this.” You nodded to him as the two of you split up, beginning your attack on the men who were advancing towards you.

As your companion began throwing punches, so did you, your body appearing to know exactly what to do at exactly the right time. Baldy began swinging his knife at you, but you were too quick. You knocked the knife out of his hand with a crescent kick, launching it into the air as it landed on the metal grating a few floors above you. Once he was disarmed, his actions seemed much more hesitant, adding to that his increasing fear of the luminescence that was still glowing under your skin.

Half of the group had disappeared now, your masked teammate scaring them off with his quick reflexes and super strength, the blonde man dropping the woman’s purse in the process. Thanks to your own heightened strength, you were able to send baldy tearing into the ground, seemingly out cold. Spider-Man nodded at your achievement before turning his attention back to the goons in front of him.

You lifted the purse from the tarmac and looked over to the woman who was curled up on the ground, leaning against the wall in fear. You let the light dissipate from your hands before approaching her cautiously, lowering your voice to try and calm her. “Are you okay, miss?” You said gently, handing her purse back to her.

“T-thank y-you.” She stammered as you helped her to her feet. “Who are you?”

“Um, call me Firefly.” You turned to the boy still in action, “And that, is Spider-Man.”

“Are you, like, superheroes or something?”

That caught you off-guard.

“Hey… you know what? Yeah. Yeah, we are.” You smiled underneath your scarf at the sound of that title.

Superhero.

The woman thanked you again before swiftly leaving the alleyway and running down the street, only half-shaken by what had just occurred.

As soon as you were sure that the lady had left safely, you turned around to find that Spider-Man had already taken down the three remaining goons and was tying them to some nearby grating by their shoelaces. You went over to help him when he turned and began looking around frantically.

“Wait. Where’s Baldy?” He asked in a worried tone. You cursed under your breath when you noticed that the man had, indeed, vanished. But a glint of light above you caught your attention.

Looking upward, you spotted the man ascending the fire escape towards the item that caught the light of the moon.

The knife.

“I got him, you stay here.” The boy shouted as he began scaling the wall in order to catch up with the man who was running up the metal stairs to retrieve his only weapon. You continued tying the rest up as Spider-Man wrestled with the man on the tiny balcony, his reflexes going into overdrive as he twisted himself out of the direction of the erratic swinging of the knife.

Your body shivered as the all too common feeling returned, coupled with a desperate and breathy shout for help. You looked up towards the two males battling it out above you to see your companion now dangling from the railings, Baldy closing in, giving him one final push before sending him hurtling towards the concrete below.

In an instant, everything went into slow motion and before you knew it, you jumped, throwing yourself towards the boy and catching him in your arms without questioning how you were doing it. You could feel a rush of wind in your face, and your companion arms that were tightly wrapped around you.

“Hey, it’s okay. I got you.” You comforted the boy who was apparently in shock. Spider-Man turned his head around to you, and then to the ground. Before you could ask him why he was acting strange, he suddenly let out a loud breath.

“Holy shit! You can fly?” He chortled, his voice exhibiting an array of emotions, mainly hysteria and disbelief.

Your blood ran cold as you looked down. Your eyes widened as you realised that you were, indeed, hovering about ten feet off the ground. Not only that, but your entire lower body was engulfed in a mass of yellow mist, enveloped in a warm light.

“Y-yeah, I guess I can?” You confirmed, your grip on the boy tightening as you lowered the two of you to the ground. Your heart was beating so rapidly that you feared you would pass out. Was this fear? Nerves?

No.

No, this was exhilaration.

“That is so cool!” Your partner acclaimed as you landed, the mist disappearing as you stumbled a little, finding your balance again. Spider-Man grabbed your shoulders, supporting you as he held you close. His breathing slowed down, suddenly making you aware of your close proximity, and how familiar it seemed.

Once Baldy was reunited with his friends on the ground, his wrists tightly wrapped around the railings beside them, you took your phone out to call the police and gave your location, hanging up before they could ask who you were. “Cops are on their way.”

“Yo! That’s what you get when you mess with Spider-Man and Firefly!” Your partner taunted excitedly, practically skipping around which didn’t help his attempt at a ‘tough demeanour’,

“Who?” Baldy grunted.

You crouched to the level of the criminals in front of you. “Us. Me and him. We’re Spider-Man and Firefly. Tell your friends. Get used to the name. Because as long as there are people like you out there, we will be there to stop you.” You spoke proudly, which encouraged a “Hell yeah we will!” from your intrepid comrade.

The two of you linked arms as you left the scene, a smile plastered on your face, albeit hidden by your disguise. “I can’t believe that you can fly!” The boy exclaimed

“Neither can I. That’s…gonna take some getting used to.” You muttered, knowing that your night had only just begun. “She called us superheroes, by the way. The lady.”

“Superheroes, huh?” Spider-Man laughed awkwardly. “It has a nice ring to it, wouldn’t you say?”

“It definitely does.”

Next Chapter (not rewritten yet)

Thanks for reading!

If you enjoyed this chapter please consider reblogging it to share it with your friends! Legend has it that every time you reblog a writer’s work, a baby is born. Don’t look that up.

I’d really appreciate any feedback you can give on this series or other work. It helps me become a better writer, and create better content for you, the reader!

Go raibh míle maith agat.

Looking upward, you spotted the man ascending the fire escape towards the item that caught the light of the moon.

The knife.

“I got him, you stay here.” The boy shouted as he began scaling the wall in order to catch up with the man who was running up the metal stairs to retrieve his only weapon. You continued tying the rest up as Spider-Man wrestled with the man on the tiny balcony, his reflexes going into overdrive as he twisted himself out of the direction of the erratic swinging of the knife.

Your body shivered as the all too common feeling returned, coupled with a desperate and breathy shout for help. You looked up towards the two males battling it out above you to see your companion now dangling from the railings, Baldy closing in, giving him one final push before sending him hurtling towards the concrete below.

In an instant, everything went into slow motion and before you knew it, you jumped, throwing yourself towards the boy and catching him in your arms without questioning how you were doing it. You could feel a rush of wind in your face, and your companion arms that were tightly wrapped around you.

“Hey, it’s okay. I got you.” You comforted the boy who was apparently in shock. Spider-Man turned his head around to you, and then to the ground. Before you could ask him why he was acting strange, he suddenly let out a loud breath.

“Holy shit! You can fly?” He chortled, his voice exhibiting an array of emotions, mainly hysteria and disbelief.

Your blood ran cold as you looked down. Your eyes widened as you realised that you were, indeed, hovering about ten feet off the ground. Not only that, but your entire lower body was engulfed in a mass of yellow mist, enveloped in a warm light.

“Y-yeah, I guess I can?” You confirmed, your grip on the boy tightening as you lowered the two of you to the ground. Your heart was beating so rapidly that you feared you would pass out. Was this fear? Nerves?

No.

No, this was exhilaration.

“That is so cool!” Your partner acclaimed as you landed, the mist disappearing as you stumbled a little, finding your balance again. Spider-Man grabbed your shoulders, supporting you as he held you close. His breathing slowed down, suddenly making you aware of your close proximity, and how familiar it seemed.

Once Baldy was reunited with his friends on the ground, his wrists tightly wrapped around the railings beside them, you took your phone out to call the police and gave your location, hanging up before they could ask who you were. “Cops are on their way.”

“Yo! That’s what you get when you mess with Spider-Man and Firefly!” Your partner taunted excitedly, practically skipping around which didn’t help his attempt at a ‘tough demeanour’,

“Who?” Baldy grunted.

You crouched to the level of the criminals in front of you. “Us. Me and him. We’re Spider-Man and Firefly. Tell your friends. Get used to the name. Because as long as there are people like you out there, we will be there to stop you.” You spoke proudly, which encouraged a “Hell yeah we will!” from your intrepid comrade.

The two of you linked arms as you left the scene, a smile plastered on your face, albeit hidden by your disguise. “I can’t believe that you can fly!” The boy exclaimed

“Neither can I. That’s…gonna take some getting used to.” You muttered, knowing that your night had only just begun. “She called us superheroes, by the way. The lady.”

“Superheroes, huh?” Spider-Man laughed awkwardly. “It has a nice ring to it, wouldn’t you say?”

“It definitely does.”

Mr Harrington was off with the flu, so your weekly, after-school meeting had been cancelled, which gave you the chance to get some homework done before meeting with your new friend - But who are you kidding?

Your homework remained neatly tidied away in your schoolbag as you sat overlooking the city, Wednesday’s sunset reaching its final stages as a faint orange hue created a perfect outline of Manhattan.

You had expected to be alone since it was hours until you were due to meet up with your partner. But, alas, there was Spider-Man, arriving only a few minutes after you.

“Firefly, huh?” Your hooded companion mulled over your name choice as he paced back and forward behind you.

“Yeah. I like it.” You responded.

“But you don’t produce fire.”

“Well, neither do fireflies.” You said, matter-of-factly.

“Fair point.” He nodded. “So, uh, what now? Where do we go from here?”

Before you could respond, you felt a chill course through your body as you shuddered. Your partner grabbed your arm.

“Did you feel that too?” He cautiously asked. You nodded before a ruckus on the streets below caught both of your attention. The click of high heels.

“Down there.” The boy whispered, his finger outstretched toward the source of the noise.

A young woman in a thick duffle coat was running down the alleyway below you, the sound of her heels becoming irregular as she realised that she was not only being followed, but that she had reached a dead end. A group of rather large men slowly approached her, lead by a bald man in a muscle tee, with a moustache that could rival Hulk Hogan. A blonde man stuck to his side, clutching onto and rummaging through the contents of the woman’s handbag. But…

If they already had her purse, then why were they still pursuing her?

Oh no.

“We need to help her. Now.” You rushed, scrambling to your feet as you stealthily began to descend the fire escape.

“Woah, woah!” Spider-Man grabbed you before you could move any further. “We need a plan of attack, we can’t just jump in there without a game plan.”

“Well, any ideas? We don’t have much time to devise something.” You said, trying to hurry the boy.

“Alright, um…!” He said as he fumbled over ideas in his head, “Okay.”

You listened intently as the boy revealed his plan.

“Have you ever seen that really old movie, The Phantom Menace?”

“Come on now, no more running, doll.,” One of the men taunted, “Nowhere for you to go!” He added, earning a low chuckle from the group. The gang leader pulled out a knife as he stalked up to the woman.

“Don’t worry, we’re gonna have some fun, just as long as you keep that pretty mouth of yours shut.” The bald man sneered, causing the woman to hyperventilate, suppressing a scream in fear of what they would do if she made a sound.

“Don’t think that’s going to happen, fellas,” Spider-Man said with an impressive amount of confidence as you stood on the edge of the fire escape directly above the action. You both jumped down, completely synchronised, landing in front of the men. “Now, how about you leave that girl alone?” He continued, which caused the group to snigger at the two of you.

“I don’t think you heard him.” You warned, your partner’s bravery seeming to ignite the courage within you. You opened your hand, watching the veins under your skin change to a warm yellow, as the light danced down the inside of your arm before surfacing at the tips of your fingers. “He said, leave the girl alone.”

“And what are you gonna do to stop us?” The leader laughed, brandishing his buck knife in your direction.

“He had to ask, didn’t he?” Spider-Man laughed as he whispered into your ear, “Okay, we got this.” You nodded to him as the two of you split up, beginning your attack on the men who were advancing towards you.

As your companion began throwing punches, so did you, your body appearing to know exactly what to do at exactly the right time. Baldy began swinging his knife at you, but you were too quick. You knocked the knife out of his hand with a crescent kick, launching it into the air as it landed on the metal grating a few floors above you. Once he was disarmed, his actions seemed much more hesitant, adding to that his increasing fear of the luminescence that was still glowing under your skin.

Half of the group had disappeared now, your masked teammate scaring them off with his quick reflexes and super strength, the blonde man dropping the woman’s purse in the process. Thanks to your own heightened strength, you were able to send baldy tearing into the ground, seemingly out cold. Spider-Man nodded at your achievement before turning his attention back to the goons in front of him.

You lifted the purse from the tarmac and looked over to the woman who was curled up on the ground, leaning against the wall in fear. You let the light dissipate from your hands before approaching her cautiously, lowering your voice to try and calm her. “Are you okay, miss?” You said gently, handing her purse back to her.

“T-thank y-you.” She stammered as you helped her to her feet. “Who are you?”

“Um, call me Firefly.” You turned to the boy still in action, “And that, is Spider-Man.”

“Are you, like, superheroes or something?”

That caught you off-guard.

“Hey… you know what? Yeah. Yeah, we are.” You smiled underneath your scarf at the sound of that title.

Superhero.

The woman thanked you again before swiftly leaving the alleyway and running down the street, only half-shaken by what had just occurred.

As soon as you were sure that the lady had left safely, you turned around to find that Spider-Man had already taken down the three remaining goons and was tying them to some nearby grating by their shoelaces. You went over to help him when he turned and began looking around frantically.

Looking upward, you spotted the man ascending the fire escape towards the item that caught the light of the moon.

“Holy shit! You can fly?” He chortled, his voice exhibiting an array of emotions, mainly hysteria and disbelief.

“Who?” Baldy grunted.

You crouched to the level of the criminals in front of you. “Us. Me and him. We’re Spider-Man and Firefly. Tell your friends. Get used to the name. Because as long as there are people like you out there, we will be there to stop you.” You spoke proudly, which encouraged a “Hell yeah we will!” from your intrepid comrade.

summary: hey loser. Write something about Peters spider tendencies? maybe? idk
question: hey loser. Write something about Peters spider tendencies? maybe? idk
answer:
A FRIEND.

it was weird enough that Tony basically adopted a full grown kid. A child. But what was even weirder was that said child could walk on the fucking ceiling.

Not only that, he had these…habits.

When the rogue avengers came back to live in the Tower, Tony wasn’t all too excited to let Peter near them. But Peter broke out the puppy dog eyes and… Well… Tony’s willpower isn’t the best when it comes to Peter.

So, Peter met everyone, and everyone met Peter. Nobody was supposed to know about his vigilante identity, but Natasha figured it out almost immediately, then Clint, and it became a slippery slope from there.

It became pretty much commonplace to walk into a room and find Peter pearched on the ceiling, going about his day like he wasn’t upside down like a goddamn bat. Or curled up in a high corner of a room in a hammock made of webs, snoozing away.

But sometimes, Peter had these habits and quirks, that could be considered disturbing to most.

Like thermoregulation.

During the winter, Peter has to wear an under suit that Tony created that keeps his body temp at a steady 99 degrees Fahrenheit. The Tower is constantly kept at 72 degrees, unless it’s summer, or unless it’s someone’s personal quarters.

The reason for this being is because if Peter gets too cold, his body starts shutting down to become dormant. Like a spider would do. And if the environment is below 23 degrees and Peter is without heat, his body begins making antifreeze to try to keep the spider part of him alive, but it begins to poison the human part of him.

So winter is a bit of a rough time for Peter and co.

Sometimes, Peter will also get into these trance like states, where he has to be in a corner, in the dark, away from everyone.

The first time he did that, it scared the living shit out of Sam.

And sometimes, when he goes into his trance like states, he gathers things into what can only be described as a nest. He finds object that are only the size of his palm, wraps them in webbing, and places them in said nest.

Honestly, the only sense they could make out of that one was that he was finding ‘eggs’ and protecting them.

It was oddly… Cute.


Peter never remembers what he does when he wakes up from his trances. So Tony has to be sure that Karen is monitoring him at all times. Ned and MJ even have his number now in case he pulls some weird ass shit at school.

summary: From the Top, a Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse/Avengers fanfiction
title: From the Top, a Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse/Avengers fanfiction
body:
Miles let go. Peter B. Parker closed his eyes as he dropped back through the rift, heading home.

It would have been nice if he’d ended up there. Instead, the veteran hero makes an unintended pit stop in another Peter’s universe - one where he’s an Avenger, of all things.

(Takes place in the MCU, post-Avengers 4)

Characters: Peter B Parker, Peter regular Parker, Tony Stark, Dr Strange, Ned Leeds, Avengers, MCU characters

Rating: T for some violence and language

Eleventh Chapter Up:

AO3 or Fanfiction.net

Excerpt:

The opening trills of “Dancing Queen” reverberated off the concrete floor and walls.

Peter quickly surveyed the area. “I was hoping for ‘Eye of the Tiger,’” he confessed, indicating the music blasting from the speakers while mentally estimating the distance to the door. The larger room outside the chamber was an open, industrial-looking bay with fifty-foot high walls. “But I guess that’s not on a lot of wedding playlists. It’s Vanessa Carlton or Black Sabbath for Tony Stark.”

Standing between him and the door in an inadvertent Charlie’s Angels action pose were Steve Rogers, Sam Wilson, and Bucky Barnes, each one a soldier and veteran of war.

tags: I know nothing about Academic Decathlon don't @ me
summary: Could you maybe write a fic about the first time that tony meets peter’s friends at like a acadec competition during the what...
question: Could you maybe write a fic about the first time that tony meets peter’s friends at like a acadec competition during the what you were then series?
answer:
Nonny, how dare you physically force me to sit down and write this when I have so much else to do?? I mean, that was so rude of you…. ;)


Peter’s Academic Decathlon regionals are in Manhattan this year. Tony schedules to have the day free of meetings and obligations a month before they even determine if Midtown is going, cause he’s determined to be there cheering Peter on.

The competing schools are already assembled when Tony gets there at 1:30. He sees Midtown, swarming around in their gold jackets. He spots Peter instantly, like a magnetic pull. The kid has the camera Tony gave him around his neck, and he’s smiling as he takes a picture of Ned and MJ messing around.

Tony watches him fondly for a second until people start noticing him, which makes Peter notice him. Tony gives him a crooked smile and a small wave and Peter carefully pulls away from his group of friends.

“Hey, Tony,” he says as he walks up. “Thanks for coming.”

“Wouldn’t miss it, kiddo,” Tony assures, following as Peter leads him through the throng of students and parents. People stare as they pass, but Tony ignores them, keeps a grounding hand on Peter’s shoulder to remind him to do the same.

Peter leads him to a seat towards the back of the auditorium, where Ned’s and MJ’s moms are. Tony smiles at them, remembering Ned’s mom from May’s funeral.

“I saved a seat for you,” Peter explains, gesturing to his ragged backpack on one of the chairs.

“Thanks, bud,” Tony says, just as a frazzled looking woman leans to speak into the microphone on the podium in the middle of the stage.

“The science portion of the quiz will begin in ten minutes. Competing students should be backstage and checking in right now.”

“Oh, crap,” Peter exclaims, looking up and seeing MJ a few feet away gesturing at him to come over. “I’ve got to go.”

“Go.“ Tony shoos him away. “Break a leg.”

Peter shoots him another smile then hurries over to MJ, Ned looking anxious over her shoulder.

MJ says something to him as Peter passes, pulling Ned along with him by the arm. Then, Tony hears in a sudden lull in the noise level of the auditorium, and Peter calls back, “Oh, hey, MJ, could you give my camera to my dad?”

Tony’s mouth goes dry. He watches as Peter unslings the expensive camera from around his neck and passes it to MJ before hurrying backstage. Neither MJ nor Ned seemed surprised by Peter’s word choice.

There are still nights when Tony replays Peter’s voice in his head, soft and muttered, as he said “You’re a good dad.” He holds onto it on bad days when he thinks he hurts more than he helps, when Peter trusts Maggie more than him. But that hadn’t been… possessive. Definitive. He hadn’t been Peter’s dad, just a dad.

My dad.

Oh my gosh, I love you, Tony thinks, staring at the place where Peter had disappeared behind the red velvet curtain. I love you I love you I love you.

My dad.

A camera shutter clicking breaks him out of his thoughts.

Tony blinks, looking down and seeing MJ standing in front of him, Peter’s camera poised in front of her eye.

“You know,” she starts casually, seeming to adjust some settings on the screen like she wasn’t even paying attention to the conversation, “I was worried, when you first adopted him. Tony Stark is known for nothing if not publicity stunts.”

Tony bristles. “It wasn’t a publici—”

“I know,” MJ interrupts. She snaps another picture and Tony scowls at her. “You did it cause you love him.”

“Twitter tell you that, too?” Tony asks coolly, ignoring the way his heart stutters at the nonchalant way she says it.

“Nope,” MJ says, taking one more picture before lowering the camera and looking directly at Tony for the first time. “You just did.”

She tosses the camera at him and Tony catches it, his heart in his throat, afraid of damaging one of Peter’s most prized possessions.

He wants to know what she means but doesn’t want to ask. “You’ve got heart eyes for days, Stark,” she says, shrugging in her bright gold jacket. “You didn’t know he calls you his dad?”

He really hates how observant this girl is. He changes the subject.

“Don’t you have a team to lead, Captain Jones?” he asks with a raised eyebrow. “Or do you want to keep psychoanalyzing me?”

“Who says I can’t do both?” She offers him a crooked grin that he has a feeling he’s privileged to see. “’Captain Jones,’” she muses as she starts walking backwards toward the stage. “I like that.”

“Don’t forget to take pictures,” she calls over her shoulder. “I want to see Flash’s face when your son wins this for us.”

Tony stares after her with he mouth open and his eyebrows furrowed for a second, before shaking his head in exasperation.

He finally takes his seat on the end of the row. People seem to have finally lost interest in him, and Ned’s mom is talking animatedly with a man on the row in front of them, so Tony turns his attention to the camera.

The playback button is taunting him.

After a moment of hesitation, Tony turns the camera on and hits the button, pulling up Peter’s most recent pictures. The first one is, of course, one of the three that MJ had taken of him.

He’s scowling down at her, the bad florescent lighting making the his face look paler and older than it should. He skips to the next one, almost the same, but this time there’s a fire in his eyes at the insinuation that he adopted Peter for any other reason that it’s Peter and Peter was his kid even before May died.

He takes a deep breath and moves on to the third.

He’s staring away from the camera, his lips slightly parted in shock. There is adoration written into every line of his face, an open tenderness in his gaze that can only mean he’s looking at Peter.

Tony swallows, looks subtly around him to make sure no one’s watching him. He looks back at the picture, his thumb hovering over the delete button.

“Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome the Academic Decathlon regional finalists participating in the science quiz portion to the stage.”

Tony jumps, looking up at the stage as kids start filing out and taking their seats. Peter’s the seventh kid to walk out, his curls extra ruffled like he’s been running his hands through it in his nerves.

Tony hesitates for one more second before turning the camera off, the picture still sitting on the memory card. He claps for his kid, grinning when Peter’s eyes find him from the stage.

I love you, he thinks again. And then, kick their butts, kiddo.

Peter does indeed win it for them, and Tony gets a close up of Flash’s face as he sits sulking at the end of the table, having answered zero questions. He thinks he’s going to get it framed for MJ.

After Midtown is awarded their trophy, they come rushing over to the section where the parents and teachers are sitting, cheering and whooping as they come. Tony stands up and immediately envelops Peter in a hug, the trophy that he’s still carrying hitting Tony in the back.

“I’m so proud of you, Pete,” Tony calls over the sounds of his teammates celebrating.

“Peter!” Someone calls, and he sees Ned’s mom with Peter’s camera that Tony had left on his seat. “Let me take a picture of you and your dad with the trophy!”

And there was that word again, glowing and addictive, and Peter doesn’t correct her, just turns in Tony’s arms and holds up the trophy.

“1, 2, 3,” she counts, and the shutter clicks.

Tony’s smile feels like it’s going to split his face in two, his heart repeating my dad my dad with every beat.

“1, 2, 3.”

On the last count, Tony unabashedly turns his head and kisses Peter on the temple just as the camera flashes.

He takes the team out for dinner, the trophy in the seat of honor at the end of the table, and Tony takes more pictures of Peter and his friends and Peter takes pictures of everyone and everything.

Later, as he and Peter drive home, he sees Peter flicking through the pictures out of the corner of his eye.

When Peter gets to the one MJ had taken of Tony before the competition, he stills. Love is written unabashedly all over Tony’s face, and he wonders if Peter realizes it’s all directed at him.

They pull up to a red light and Tony risks a glance over at Peter. He’s still looking at the picture.

“See any you like?” Tony asks, trying to sound casual.

Peter looks up at him. “Yeah. Yeah, there are a few I’m going to print out.” There’s a small moment of silence as everything unsaid hangs in the air. “That one you got of Flash belongs in the MoMA.”

Tony laughs. The light turns green and Tony eases onto the accelerator. “I think I’m going to frame it for MJ.”

Two weeks later, when Maggie steals Tony’s left shoe and he chases her into Peter’s room trying to get it back, he sees three new pictures on Peter’s wall. One of Peter, Ned, and MJ celebrating their win, the second of Tony and Peter and the trophy, the one where Tony was kissing Peter, the boy’s eye scrunched closed in surprise, and the third, the one MJ had taken of him looking at Peter.

Tony smiles to himself and leaves, deciding to just wear a different pair of shoes.

“Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome the Academic Decathlon regional finalists participating in the science quiz portion to the stage.”

Tony jumps, looking up at the stage as kids start filing out and taking their seats. Peter’s the seventh kid to walk out, his curls extra ruffled like he’s been running his hands through it in his nerves.

Tony hesitates for one more second before turning the camera off, the picture still sitting on the memory card. He claps for his kid, grinning when Peter’s eyes find him from the stage.

I love you, he thinks again. And then, kick their butts, kiddo.

Peter does indeed win it for them, and Tony gets a close up of Flash’s face as he sits sulking at the end of the table, having answered zero questions. He thinks he’s going to get it framed for MJ.

After Midtown is awarded their trophy, they come rushing over to the section where the parents and teachers are sitting, cheering and whooping as they come. Tony stands up and immediately envelops Peter in a hug, the trophy that he’s still carrying hitting Tony in the back.

“I’m so proud of you, Pete,” Tony calls over the sounds of his teammates celebrating.

“Peter!” Someone calls, and he sees Ned’s mom with Peter’s camera that Tony had left on his seat. “Let me take a picture of you and your dad with the trophy!”

And there was that word again, glowing and addictive, and Peter doesn’t correct her, just turns in Tony’s arms and holds up the trophy.

“1, 2, 3,” she counts, and the shutter clicks.

Tony’s smile feels like it’s going to split his face in two, his heart repeating my dad my dad with every beat.

“1, 2, 3.”

On the last count, Tony unabashedly turns his head and kisses Peter on the temple just as the camera flashes.

He takes the team out for dinner, the trophy in the seat of honor at the end of the table, and Tony takes more pictures of Peter and his friends and Peter takes pictures of everyone and everything.

Later, as he and Peter drive home, he sees Peter flicking through the pictures out of the corner of his eye.

When Peter gets to the one MJ had taken of Tony before the competition, he stills. Love is written unabashedly all over Tony’s face, and he wonders if Peter realizes it’s all directed at him.

They pull up to a red light and Tony risks a glance over at Peter. He’s still looking at the picture.

“See any you like?” Tony asks, trying to sound casual.

Peter looks up at him. “Yeah. Yeah, there are a few I’m going to print out.” There’s a small moment of silence as everything unsaid hangs in the air. “That one you got of Flash belongs in the MoMA.”

Tony laughs. The light turns green and Tony eases onto the accelerator. “I think I’m going to frame it for MJ.”

Two weeks later, when Maggie steals Tony’s left shoe and he chases her into Peter’s room trying to get it back, he sees three new pictures on Peter’s wall. One of Peter, Ned, and MJ celebrating their win, the second of Tony and Peter and the trophy, the one where Tony was kissing Peter, the boy’s eye scrunched closed in surprise, and the third, the one MJ had taken of him looking at Peter.

Tony smiles to himself and leaves, deciding to just wear a different pair of shoes.

Nonny, how dare you physically force me to sit down and write this when I have so much else to do?? I mean, that was so rude of you…. ;)


Peter’s Academic Decathlon regionals are in Manhattan this year. Tony schedules to have the day free of meetings and obligations a month before they even determine if Midtown is going, cause he’s determined to be there cheering Peter on.

The competing schools are already assembled when Tony gets there at 1:30. He sees Midtown, swarming around in their gold jackets. He spots Peter instantly, like a magnetic pull. The kid has the camera Tony gave him around his neck, and he’s smiling as he takes a picture of Ned and MJ messing around.

Tony watches him fondly for a second until people start noticing him, which makes Peter notice him. Tony gives him a crooked smile and a small wave and Peter carefully pulls away from his group of friends.

“Hey, Tony,” he says as he walks up. “Thanks for coming.”

“Wouldn’t miss it, kiddo,” Tony assures, following as Peter leads him through the throng of students and parents. People stare as they pass, but Tony ignores them, keeps a grounding hand on Peter’s shoulder to remind him to do the same.

Peter leads him to a seat towards the back of the auditorium, where Ned’s and MJ’s moms are. Tony smiles at them, remembering Ned’s mom from May’s funeral.

“I saved a seat for you,” Peter explains, gesturing to his ragged backpack on one of the chairs.

“Thanks, bud,” Tony says, just as a frazzled looking woman leans to speak into the microphone on the podium in the middle of the stage.

“The science portion of the quiz will begin in ten minutes. Competing students should be backstage and checking in right now.”

“Oh, crap,” Peter exclaims, looking up and seeing MJ a few feet away gesturing at him to come over. “I’ve got to go.”

“Go.“ Tony shoos him away. “Break a leg.”

Peter shoots him another smile then hurries over to MJ, Ned looking anxious over her shoulder.

MJ says something to him as Peter passes, pulling Ned along with him by the arm. Then, Tony hears in a sudden lull in the noise level of the auditorium, and Peter calls back, “Oh, hey, MJ, could you give my camera to my dad?”

Tony’s mouth goes dry. He watches as Peter unslings the expensive camera from around his neck and passes it to MJ before hurrying backstage. Neither MJ nor Ned seemed surprised by Peter’s word choice.

There are still nights when Tony replays Peter’s voice in his head, soft and muttered, as he said “You’re a good dad.” He holds onto it on bad days when he thinks he hurts more than he helps, when Peter trusts Maggie more than him. But that hadn’t been… possessive. Definitive. He hadn’t been Peter’s dad, just a dad.

My dad.

Oh my gosh, I love you, Tony thinks, staring at the place where Peter had disappeared behind the red velvet curtain. I love you I love you I love you.

My dad.

A camera shutter clicking breaks him out of his thoughts.

Tony blinks, looking down and seeing MJ standing in front of him, Peter’s camera poised in front of her eye.

“You know,” she starts casually, seeming to adjust some settings on the screen like she wasn’t even paying attention to the conversation, “I was worried, when you first adopted him. Tony Stark is known for nothing if not publicity stunts.”

Tony bristles. “It wasn’t a publici—”

“I know,” MJ interrupts. She snaps another picture and Tony scowls at her. “You did it cause you love him.”

“Twitter tell you that, too?” Tony asks coolly, ignoring the way his heart stutters at the nonchalant way she says it.

“Nope,” MJ says, taking one more picture before lowering the camera and looking directly at Tony for the first time. “You just did.”

She tosses the camera at him and Tony catches it, his heart in his throat, afraid of damaging one of Peter’s most prized possessions.

He wants to know what she means but doesn’t want to ask. “You’ve got heart eyes for days, Stark,” she says, shrugging in her bright gold jacket. “You didn’t know he calls you his dad?”

He really hates how observant this girl is. He changes the subject.

“Don’t you have a team to lead, Captain Jones?” he asks with a raised eyebrow. “Or do you want to keep psychoanalyzing me?”

“Who says I can’t do both?” She offers him a crooked grin that he has a feeling he’s privileged to see. “’Captain Jones,’” she muses as she starts walking backwards toward the stage. “I like that.”

“Don’t forget to take pictures,” she calls over her shoulder. “I want to see Flash’s face when your son wins this for us.”

Tony stares after her with he mouth open and his eyebrows furrowed for a second, before shaking his head in exasperation.

He finally takes his seat on the end of the row. People seem to have finally lost interest in him, and Ned’s mom is talking animatedly with a man on the row in front of them, so Tony turns his attention to the camera.

The playback button is taunting him.

After a moment of hesitation, Tony turns the camera on and hits the button, pulling up Peter’s most recent pictures. The first one is, of course, one of the three that MJ had taken of him.

He’s scowling down at her, the bad florescent lighting making the his face look paler and older than it should. He skips to the next one, almost the same, but this time there’s a fire in his eyes at the insinuation that he adopted Peter for any other reason that it’s Peter and Peter was his kid even before May died.

He takes a deep breath and moves on to the third.

He’s staring away from the camera, his lips slightly parted in shock. There is adoration written into every line of his face, an open tenderness in his gaze that can only mean he’s looking at Peter.

Tony swallows, looks subtly around him to make sure no one’s watching him. He looks back at the picture, his thumb hovering over the delete button.

“Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome the Academic Decathlon regional finalists participating in the science quiz portion to the stage.”

Tony jumps, looking up at the stage as kids start filing out and taking their seats. Peter’s the seventh kid to walk out, his curls extra ruffled like he’s been running his hands through it in his nerves.

Tony hesitates for one more second before turning the camera off, the picture still sitting on the memory card. He claps for his kid, grinning when Peter’s eyes find him from the stage.

After Midtown is awarded their trophy, they come rushing over to the section where the parents and teachers are sitting, cheering and whooping as they come. Tony stands up and immediately envelops Peter in a hug, the trophy that he’s still carrying hitting Tony in the back.

“I’m so proud of you, Pete,” Tony calls over the sounds of his teammates celebrating.

“Peter!” Someone calls, and he sees Ned’s mom with Peter’s camera that Tony had left on his seat. “Let me take a picture of you and your dad with the trophy!”

And there was that word again, glowing and addictive, and Peter doesn’t correct her, just turns in Tony’s arms and holds up the trophy.

“1, 2, 3,” she counts, and the shutter clicks.

Tony’s smile feels like it’s going to split his face in two, his heart repeating my dad my dad with every beat.

“1, 2, 3.”

On the last count, Tony unabashedly turns his head and kisses Peter on the temple just as the camera flashes.

He takes the team out for dinner, the trophy in the seat of honor at the end of the table, and Tony takes more pictures of Peter and his friends and Peter takes pictures of everyone and everything.

Later, as he and Peter drive home, he sees Peter flicking through the pictures out of the corner of his eye.

When Peter gets to the one MJ had taken of Tony before the competition, he stills. Love is written unabashedly all over Tony’s face, and he wonders if Peter realizes it’s all directed at him.

“See any you like?” Tony asks, trying to sound casual.

Peter looks up at him. “Yeah. Yeah, there are a few I’m going to print out.” There’s a small moment of silence as everything unsaid hangs in the air. “That one you got of Flash belongs in the MoMA.”

Tony laughs. The light turns green and Tony eases onto the accelerator. “I think I’m going to frame it for MJ.”

summary: Can you do submissive peter parker smut please.
question: Can you do submissive peter parker smut please.
answer:
spiderman likes to think he’s important. or rather, he enjoys the feeling of cops and citizens crowding around him. he gets invites to speak at events- usually shouted at him while he’s swinging through the city, since he doesn’t exactly have a PO box. he accepts very few of them: some schools, to talk about being a hero and doing the right thing to excited fourth graders, some universities, to talk about dealing with pressure.

you don’t remember what this function is for. its a bunch of adults crowded into a room for a good cause, you know that much. some sort of fundraiser. 

the particulars aren’t very important to you. since peter’s attending as Spiderman, you weren’t able to be there as his date. so you’re here alone, having secured a ticket through the normal channels instead of someone throwing it at you on the street. the things you do for him.

or rather, the things you do to him. to knock him down a peg or two. help remind him who’s really in charge.

you shift the remote a little higher. your eyes are locked on where he sits in his full spiderman gear, the guest of honor on the stage. he’s playing the part of casual city hero very well but you can see the tension thrumming through him. you can see him twitch, just a little jolt, when you turn the vibration up higher. 

you’re really very impressed with his composure. when you’d inserted the plug for him before you both got dressed for the night, you’d made sure the vibrating tip was nestled right up against his prostate. he’d begged you to have mercy on him as you lubed it up, as you pushed it past his tight ring of muscle and tested the remote control. 

he’d begged for mercy so prettily that you were even nice enough to place a cock ring around his base for him. so you could play with him and work him up all night and he’d never have to worry about messing his suit in front of everyone.

 how embarrassing that would be, to have everyone see the city’s hero for the desperate little slut he really is.

he hasn’t even gotten to his speech yet. you watch his hand tremble when he reaches out for a glass of water and grin.

summary: So wait, freaking Mary Jane is a playable character but not the Black Cat??! Are you shitting on me, Insomniac games?? This is...
body: So wait, freaking Mary Jane is a playable character but not the Black Cat??! Are you shitting on me, Insomniac games?? This is what we would’ve gotten had Vicki Vale been a playable character instead of Catwoman in Arkham City. It just doesn’t work like that. You don’t need to make MJ anymore important than she ‘supposedly’ is😑 That’s why the Heist DLC failed to impress me. Not only did they mess up Felicia’s character, but we didn’t even get to play as her. And not to mention this stupid/irritating theme of Peter ending up with Mary Jane in every fucking universe. Give me a damn break. I lose interest everytime this is repeated. And I don’t give a shit if Black Cat is playable in the sequel. You have disappointed me enough.
